title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

09:32 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:46 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: I'm looking at http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests-3.1/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/12/testReport/org.xwiki.test.selenium/WatchListTest/testWatchThisPageAndWholeSpace/ looks like a fix made an hidden bug visible, according to the error watchlist is trying to get user xwiki:Main.WebHome watched elements but this user does not exists obviously  
09:49 <+tmortagne> for some reason a watchlist object is added to xwiki:Main.WebHome document during tests  
09:50 <+tmortagne> in any case watchlist should support even error like that, lets be safe  
09:54 <+tmortagne> hmm actually there is a proper try/catch already which is what is printed in the console  
09:54 <+tmortagne> so there is something wrong with the test  
09:55 <vmassol> fyi I'm adding screenshot capture. Almost ready

11:57 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:02 <qwebirc80844> has joined #xwiki  
12:02 <qwebirc80844> Hello, what is the "AnnotationCode" space?  
12:03 <qwebirc80844> and: why is it not visible by default to non-auth users? I am OK that it is NOT visible since I don't know its purpose, I am just wondering WHY in terms or RIGHTS MANAGEMENT it is not visible (i.e. I don't see the magic/logic where it happens)  
12:06 <vmassol> qwebirc80844: it's a technical space containing the code in wiki pages for the annotation feature  
12:06 <vmassol> it's a hidden space in the list of "blacklisted" spaces  
12:06 <vmassol> this list is defined in a template (.vm) file  
12:06 <vmassol> (and can be overridden in a wiki page)  
12:07 <vmassol> xwikivars.vm  
12:07 <qwebirc80844> oh, thanks! there is magic in there!  
12:09 <vmassol> qwebirc80844: see https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/xwikivars.vm  
12:09 <vmassol> #set ($blacklistedSpaces = ['Import', 'Panels', 'Scheduler', 'Stats', 'XAppClasses', 'XAppSheets', 'XAppTemplates', 'XWiki', 'WatchCode', 'WatchSheets', 'XApp', 'WatchAdmin', 'Watch', 'ColorThemes', 'AnnotationCode'])  
12:09 <vmassol> in the future we'll improve this to make it less magic  
12:09 <vmassol> ie spaces themselves will tell whether they're "hidden"/"technical" or not  
12:10 <qwebirc80844> yes, as an attribute of some sort, would make sense  
12:11 <qwebirc80844> Also, would it be risky to set "Unregistered Users" a negative right to VIEW at the WIKI level and ONLY enable it explicitely for the spaces I want them to be able to see?  
12:12 <qwebirc80844> In case somebody creates a secret space and forgets to explicitly forbids access to Unregistered Users  
12:12 <qwebirc80844> I'd imagine I'd need to add some explicit VIEW rights to some hidden space (templates, etc.)  
12:25 <+tmortagne> qwebirc80844: don't give negative right unless you absolutely need too, just give the right to someone else and Guest will loose the right  
12:26 <+tmortagne> said another way if you give a right to anyone the right loose inheritance for everyone at this level  
12:29 <qwebirc80844> OK, I see. That works with Groups as well? i.e. if I give a right to a GROUP, do I actually REMOVE that right for the "Unregistered users" or not?  
12:30 <+tmortagne> yep groups and users work the same way  
12:30 <qwebirc80844> k  
12:30 <+tmortagne> we generally only use groups for right and then you just need to modify groups  
12:30 <qwebirc80844> Any idea why the "Invitation" space is visible to a dumb user DESPITE having explicitly negative rights set for "XWikiAllGroup"?  
12:31 <qwebirc80844> (this "dumb" user is part of no group outside of the implicit XWikiAllGroup)  
12:32 <+tmortagne> right is only used when you really access the object but not when just listing them  
12:32 <+tmortagne> I think there is a jira issue about that  
12:32 <qwebirc80844> No, I can actually click on it and it shows me the screen where I can send an invite (Invitation messenger)  
12:33 <qwebirc80844> While for other spaces, If I explicitly put negative rights, they don't even get listed, which is what I'd expect  
12:33 <+tmortagne> arre you sure right is forbidden  then ?  
12:33 <+tmortagne> maybe there is some right at the page level  
12:33 <qwebirc80844> The entire line has red circles for XWikiAllGroup  
12:33 <+tmortagne> overriding the sapce right  
12:33 <+tmortagne> forget that  
12:33 <+tmortagne> actually negative right as prioprity  
12:33 <+tmortagne> priority  
12:34 <+tmortagne> I don't know well invitation application so I could not tell you what's wrong exactly  
12:34 <+tmortagne> what is the URL of the page you are accessing that you should not ?  
12:35 <qwebirc80844> http://wiki.cloudbees.com/bin/view/Invitation/WebHome  
12:35 <+tmortagne> indeed if you gave negative right to guest on Invitation space I really don't see how you can acces this page  
12:36 <qwebirc80844> maybe because it is an application, it gets different treatment  
12:36 <+tmortagne> nop  
12:36 <+tmortagne> the aapplication is a script in the page  
12:36 <+tmortagne> but the script should not even be executed since you don't have the right  
12:37 <qwebirc80844> indeed, strange...  
12:37 <+tmortagne> try reconfiguring your right avoiding negative rights  
12:39 <qwebirc80844> same thing  
12:40 <qwebirc80844> I've put GREEN to ADMIN on all rights, then empty box for AllGroup and my dumb user can still see it  
12:45 <qwebirc80844> found: http://xwiki.markmail.org/search/?q=disable+invitation+space+list%3Aorg.xwiki.users#query:disable%20invitation%20space%20list%3Aorg.xwiki.users+page:1+mid:3hq62sm22jwwvzcq+state:results  
12:46 <qwebirc80844> tricky :)  
12:46 <+tmortagne> always check the whole inheritance chain :)  
12:46 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
12:47 <+tmortagne> did not looked at the details but does not sounds very nice to have custom right on theses pages to me  
12:47 <qwebirc80844> yes, as you said  
12:47 <qwebirc80844> I just want to disable it, which means unset rights on that page and we are good to go  
12:48 <qwebirc80844> I couldn't find the access rights for that page from the invitation page itself, had to list all pages from the space instead and do it from there  
12:50 <+tmortagne> qwebirc80844: is you user configured as advanced user ?  
12:50 <+tmortagne> then you get a dropdown list on edit containing right editor among other things  
12:51 <+tmortagne> edit=edit button on the top left corner of the document content  
13:20 <mflorea> has quit  
13:27 <qwebirc80844> yes, I am , but NOT with that screen! That's part of what's being said on the forum post I think, this has been overriden, no?  
13:36 <+sburjan> hello vmassol. Do you have time to talk about Oracle ?  
13:38 <abusenius> has quit  
13:40 <+tmortagne> qwebirc80844: advanced user property can't be overriden AFAIK  
13:40 <+tmortagne> i'm not talking about a right here  
13:46 <evalica> has quit  
13:52 <qwebirc80844> another "funny one": I am displaying the list of "spaces" on the right of my screen. If I go on one of my spaces (Documentation), then I get a FULL list of spaces, even the ones I can't access if I click on them, while if I go on a different space (DEV), then the list of spaces that get displayed is much smaller and correspond to the ones I've access to. The space panel has the same code in both...  
13:58 <mpaun> has quit  
14:01 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:02 <vmassol> sburjan: hi  
14:02 <vmassol> go ahead  
14:06 <+sburjan> I wanted to ask which of the issues I should report to JIRA in order to create the MTR  
14:06 <vmassol> all issues shuold be reported, not sure I understand  
14:07 <vmassol> do you have an example?  
14:07 <+sburjan> look in the link from the mail thread.  
14:07 <vmassol> sorry don't have the time right now  
14:07 <+sburjan> we had some questions bouncing there, but we hadn;y reached a conclusion  
14:07 <vmassol> just report issues  
14:07 <vmassol> if you're not sure it's an issue you need to test again probably  
14:08 <vmassol> or work with someoe to understand if it's a problem  
14:08 <+sburjan> ok. I will report everything there, and we'll see what's next from there  
14:08 <+sburjan> well i need someone from platform that could tell me which of those are real bugs and which could be only configuration issues  
14:09 <vmassol> I think you need someone to work on the oracle issues indeed  
14:09 <vmassol> to analyze what you did and do more tests  
14:09 <vmassol> right now most of us are busy trying to stabilize the tests for the release  
14:09 <+sburjan> for more transparency I can report everything from that page, and it can be closed after if it's not a real issue  
14:09 <+sburjan> yes, I know  
14:09 <vmassol> I could work with you on this but not before next week  
14:10 <+sburjan> so wdyt ? report on JIRA to be there, or wait for a platform dev to become available ?  
14:10 <vmassol> from what I've seen there was nothing conclusive  
14:10 <vmassol> so better wait for a dev to work with you on analyzing/redoing tests I think  
14:11 <+sburjan> ok  
14:11 <mpaun> has joined #xwiki  
14:26 <vmassol> meeting over…. continuing adding screenshot feature. I'm debugging it… it takes too many screenshots right now ;)  
14:27 <vmassol> ok found why…. fixing

15:13 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: Where do we have a dependency on hibernate-validator?  
15:14 <@sdumitriu> If you know already  
15:14 <vmassol> in xwiki-propeties AFAIK  
15:15 <vmassol> xwiki-platform-properties  
15:16 <@sdumitriu> I think it's mandatory for hibernate 3.6  
16:10 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
16:14 <vmassol> has quit  
16:22 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: it's not a dependency  
16:22 <+tmortagne> it's actually using standard validation API if it can find an implementation  
16:23 <+tmortagne> and the implementation is actually a dependency of XE web  
16:23 <+tmortagne> standard bind validation  
16:29 <+tmortagne> said another way xwiki-properties does not really need it but if a macro wants to use java bean validation it support it  
16:30 <@sdumitriu> Well, it is needed now for the storage to work  
16:31 <+tmortagne> ok, is there an issue with  that ?  
16:31 <@sdumitriu> No, just wanted to check the version used there  
16:31 <jvelociter> has quit  
16:32 <@sdumitriu> Not to introduce a conflict  
16:32 <+tmortagne> ok then the answer is as long as it support java bean validation xwiki-properties does not care of the version

16:42 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle should know that  
16:51 <Sideup> i'm trying to mimic #tcl if that would help give you guys an idea, i came across this room in search of this Jabber/IRC Bridge
